intro: Stomadena, commonly known as the nightshade, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Solanaceae family. These plants are characterized by their showy, often brightly colored flowers and typically have glandular hairs on their stems and leaves. Stomadena species are native to various regions in the Americas and are often found in tropical and subtropical climates. They produce berries that contain toxic alkaloids, making them potentially harmful to humans and animals. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for ornamental purposes due to their attractive foliage and flowers.
